intro: Conostylis sulphurea, commonly known as the sulphur conostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in dense clusters. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Conostylis sulphurea is often found in open habitats such as woodlands and grasslands.
